org.edg.data.replication.optorsim.infrastructure
Interface StorageElement

All Known Implementing Classes:
AccessHistoryStorageElement, EconomicBinomialStorageElement, EconomicZipfStorageElement, LfuStorageElement, LruStorageElement, SimpleStorageElement
public interface StorageElement

The StorageElement (SE) is where DataFiles in the Grid are stored. It represents a hard disk with methods which enable the Grid to manipulate the data stored on it. This interface describes the basic file handling methods such as adding files, deleting files and querying how much space is available. The most interesting method in terms of optimisation is filesToDelete(org.edg.data.replication.optorsim.infrastructure.DataFile). Each implementation defines its own algorithm to control which file(s) should be deleted if the storage is full and space must be made for a new file. This algorithm defines the optimisation strategy being used.

SimpleStorageElement provides the basic implementation of this interface and all other StorageElements extend SimpleStorageElement and overload filesToDelete(org.edg.data.replication.optorsim.infrastructure.DataFile) with their own optimisation algorithm.

Copyright (c) 2004 CERN, ITC-irst, PPARC, on behalf of the EU DataGrid. For license conditions see LICENSE file or http://www.edg.org/license.html

Since:
JDK1.4

boolean isTherePotentialAvailableSpace(DataFile newFile)
Calculates whether there space could be created for a new files by deleting files that are not masters or pinned.

int numberOfStoredFiles()

reserveSpace

boolean reserveSpace(int filesize)
Method used at the start of a file transfer to ensure the space reserved for the replicated file is not used. When the file transfer has completed, addPreReservedFile(org.edg.data.replication.optorsim.infrastructure.DataFile) should be called to register the file with the StorageElement.

Returns:
true if operation succeeded

listFiles

java.lang.String listFiles()
Query the StorageElement, asking it to list all stored files in a human readable format.

Returns:
A textual description of all stored files

addFile

boolean addFile(DataFile file)
Add a DataFile to the SE. This method should only be used for files added "instantaneously" to the SE, for example when files are distributed around the Grid at the start of the simulation. For file replication reserveSpace(int) followed by addPreReservedFile(org.edg.data.replication.optorsim.infrastructure.DataFile) should be used.

Returns:
true if successful, false if not.

addPreReservedFile

void addPreReservedFile(DataFile file)
Add a DataFile to the SE. This assumes reserveSpace(int) has been called first and is called at the end of a file transfer to register the file with the SE.

removeFile

void removeFile(DataFile file)
Remove a file from the SE (only works if file is not pinned).

hasFile

boolean hasFile(java.lang.String name)
Method used to query the SE if it has a DataFile whose name matches the given String.

Returns:
true if the SE has such a file, false if not.

requestFile

DataFile requestFile(java.lang.String filename)
This method returns the DataFile object whose name is specified in the method argument.

Returns:
The DataFile corresponding to filename.

accessFile

void accessFile(DataFile file)
register an access to a DataFile on this SE.

filesToDelete

java.util.List filesToDelete(DataFile file)
If the SE is full and a new file is to be replicated to it this method is called to choose a file to delete to create the space required. Each StorageElement's implementation of this method defines the optimisation algorithm used.

Returns:
The List of files to be deleted when space is needed on the SE.
